titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Yearbook Collection BCMS.0031
titlestmt.author: Brooklyn Collection staff with contributions by Alla Roylance, Librarian; Ally Malinenko, Librarian; Diana Bowers-Smith, Archivist

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-01-12 14:43:57 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A collection of yearbooks from Brooklyn schools.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn Yearbook Collection spans over 100 years of Brooklyn educational history. In addition to the class listings and photographs that are useful in genealogical research, the yearbooks provide a wealth of information about academics, clubs, athletic groups, and student activities in Brooklyn in the 19th and 20th centuries. Many of the publications included in this collection are compendiums of student artwork and writing, with visually striking design and content. The collection is consistently growing due to active acquisitions and donations.

userestrict.head: Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: This is a composite collection from many different sources that include both purchases and donations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The yearbooks are arranged alphabetically by school name. Each school's yearbooks are arranged chronologically on the shelf. The yearbooks' titles are noted, but do not affect the physical arrangement.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society ephemera collection (ARC.272) and Brooklyn Ephemera collection (BCMS.0007): Many of the schools listed here are also represented in our ephemera files, which contain graduation ceremony programs, report cards, invitations, and other materials.
Brooklyn High School Newspaper collection (BCMS.0030): A collection of publications from Brooklyn schools, covering life in the schools as well as events in their communities.
Class Photographs Collection (BCMS.0029): A small collection of group photographs from Brooklyn schools, spanning the years 1904-2002.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn yearbook collection, BCMS.0031; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

scopecontent.p: 1944, 1945, 1963 & 1964 are art and literary supplements to the yearbook, not the yearbook proper.
